Question_1.Context: The study aimed to develop a radiolabeled anti-TROP-2 antibody for immunoPET and SPECT imaging in TNBC tumor-bearing models. Results showed high binding affinity of NY003 to TROP-2 through ELISA.
Question_1.Question: What is the main purpose of developing the radiolabeled anti-TROP-2 antibody NY003?
Question_1.A: To study the biodistribution of TROP-2 in tumors
Question_1.B: To predict the response to immunotherapy in TNBC patients
Question_1.C: To non-invasively detect TROP-2 expression in tumors
Question_1.D: To evaluate the efficacy of chemotherapy in TNBC
Question_1.Source: The study aimed to develop a 89Zr/177Lu-radiolabeled anti-TROP-2 antibody NY003 for immunoPET and SPECT imaging in TNBC tumor-bearing model.

Question_2.Context: The radiolabeling synthesis methods for [89Zr]Zr-DFO-NY003 and [177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003 were similar to the previous reports of NY004. The radiochemical purity of [89Zr]Zr-DFO-NY003/[177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003 exceeded 95% and remained stable within 144h p.i. in vitro.
Question_2.Question: What was the radiochemical purity of [89Zr]Zr-DFO-NY003/[177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003?
Question_2.Source: The radiochemical purity of [89Zr]Zr-DFO-NY003/[177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003 exceeded 95% and remained stable within 144h p.i. in vitro.

Question_3.Context: MDA-MB-231 xenograft tumor-bearing models were established for imaging and therapeutic efficacy investigation. The expression level of xenograft tumors was determined by IHC, all the samples demonstrated weak to moderate positive TROP-2 expression.
Question_3.Question: How was the TROP-2 expression level in the MDA-MB-231 xenograft tumors characterized?
Question_3.Source: The expression level of xenograft tumors was determined by IHC, all the samples demonstrated weak to moderate positive TROP-2 expression.

Question_4.Context: The mice were intravenously injected with 5.55–7.4 MBq of [89Zr]Zr-DFO-NY003 via the tail vein, and the Micro-PET scans were performed at different time points p.i.. The representative Micro-PET images of tumor-bearing mice were summarized.
Question_4.Question: What was the main advantage of using 89Zr for radiolabeling in the study?
Question_4.Source: 89Zr is one of the most ideal choices because of its relatively long physical half-life, which is a good match for antibody pharmacokinetics. Moreover, the high γ-energy and good spatial resolution of 89Zr result in high-resolution and excellent-quality PET images.

Question_5.Context: The mice in the low-dose and high-dose groups were injected with [177Lu] Lu-DTPA-NY003 of 11.1 or 18.5 MBq (200 μL), and the three control groups were injected with 177LuCl3 solution, non-labeled NY003 antibody, or saline, respectively.
Question_5.Question: What was the purpose of injecting the mice with [177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003?
Question_5.A: To study the biodistribution of TROP-2 in tumors
Question_5.B: To evaluate the efficacy of chemotherapy in TNBC
Question_5.C: To predict the response to immunotherapy in TNBC patients
Question_5.D: To suppress tumor growth through RIT
Question_5.Source: To evaluate the anti-tumor efficacy of [177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003, a pilot experiment was conducted using five groups of the TROP-2-overexpressing MDA-MB-231 tumor-bearing mice.

Question_6.Context: The hematological analysis and histological staining results proved that [177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003 could kill tumor cells while causing minimal toxicity to other healthy tissues and organs.
Question_6.Question: What was observed in the liver and spleen after treatment with [177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003?
Question_6.Source: Hepatic congestion and splenic white pulp atrophy were observed in low- and high-dose and NY003-only groups, illustrating some toxic effects after RIT treatment.

Question_7.Context: The study demonstrated that [89Zr]Zr-DFO-NY003/[177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003 could non-invasively detect the expression of TROP-2 in tumors through specific immun- oPET and SPECT imaging.
Question_7.Question: What was the main advantage of using immunoPET and SPECT imaging in the study?
Question_7.Source: The study demonstrated that [89Zr]Zr-DFO-NY003/[177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003 could non-invasively detect the expression of TROP-2 in tumors through specific immunoPET and SPECT imaging.

Question_8.Context: The study aimed to develop a radiolabeled anti-TROP-2 antibody for immunoPET and SPECT imaging in TNBC tumor-bearing models. Results showed high binding affinity of NY003 to TROP-2 through ELISA.
Question_8.Question: What was the method used to determine the binding affinity of NY003 to TROP-2?
Question_8.Source: The high binding affinity of NY003 to TROP-2 was verified through ELISA.

Question_9.Context: The mice were anesthetized with 3% (v/v) isoflurane and underwent Micro-PET or Micro-SPECT scans with continuous 1% (v/v) isoflurane. The images were acquired at different time points p.i..
Question_9.Question: What was the purpose of anesthetizing the mice during the imaging scans?
Question_9.Source: The mice were anesthetized with 3% (v/v) isoflurane and underwent Micro-PET or Micro-SPECT scans with continuous 1% (v/v) isoflurane.

Question_10.Context: The study demonstrated that [89Zr]Zr-DFO-NY003/[177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003 could non-invasively detect the expression of TROP-2 in tumors through specific immun- oPET and SPECT imaging.
Question_10.Question: What was the main benefit of using [177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003 in the study?
Question_10.A: To study the biodistribution of TROP-2 in tumors
Question_10.B: To predict the response to immunotherapy in TNBC patients
Question_10.C: To suppress tumor growth through RIT
Question_10.D: To evaluate the efficacy of chemotherapy in TNBC
Question_10.Source: The study demonstrated that [177Lu]Lu-DTPA-NY003 could suppress tumor growth through RIT in TROP-2 over-expression TNBC models.
